project_description: The Flutter application follows the Stacked architecture, featuring routing, dependency injection, and dialog/bottom sheet management. It includes a startup screen, a home screen with a counter, a dialog, and a bottom sheet. The application also integrates with Firebase for analytics tracking and supports localization and multiple flavors (development and production).
architecture_overview: The application is structured using the Stacked architecture, which separates the concerns of the UI, view models, and services. It uses Stacked for state management, routing, and dependency injection. The main components include the App, AppView, and various feature-specific views and view models. The application also utilizes services for managing dialogs, bottom sheets, and navigation, as well as observing screen transitions for analytics purposes.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes (HomeView, StartupView), services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService), bottom sheets (NoticeSheet), and dialogs (InfoAlertDialog). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.name: lib/l10n/localizations_extension.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides an extension on the BuildContext class to make it easier to access the current AppLocalizations instance, which is responsible for managing the application's localization and internationalization.

methods.name: localizations
methods.description: Retrieves the current AppLocalizations instance for the given BuildContext.

files.name: lib/app/app.bottomsheets.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the bottom sheet UI in the Flutter application. It sets up the custom bottom sheet builders for different types of bottom sheets, allowing the application to display various types of bottom sheets as needed.

methods.name: setupBottomSheetUi
methods.description: Sets up the custom bottom sheet builders for different types of bottom sheets, allowing the application to display various types of bottom sheets as needed.

files.name: lib/l10n/supported_locales.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for managing the supported locales and localization delegates for the Flutter application. It provides a centralized and reusable way to handle the internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) of the app.

methods.name: localizationsDelegates
methods.description: Returns a list of localization delegates that provide the translation and formatting logic for the application's strings.

methods.name: supportedLocales
methods.description: Returns a list of locales that the application supports for translation and formatting.

files.name: lib/app/app.router.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the navigation and routing within the Flutter application. It defines the available routes, the corresponding views, and provides utility methods to navigate between these views.

methods.name: navigateToHomeView
methods.description: Navigates to the HomeView screen.

methods.name: navigateToStartupView
methods.description: Navigates to the StartupView screen.

methods.name: replaceWithHomeView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the HomeView screen.

methods.name: replaceWithStartupView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the StartupView screen.

files.name: lib/main/bootstrap.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for bootstrapping the Flutter application, setting up the necessary dependencies, and running the main app widget. It serves as the entry point for the application, ensuring a consistent initialization process across different app flavors.

methods.name: bootstrap
methods.description: This is the main entry point function that initializes the application. It sets up the app's flavor, ensures the WidgetsFlutterBinding is initialized, and configures the app's orientation, locator, dialog UI, and bottom sheet UI. Finally, it runs the main app widget provided by the caller.

files.name: lib/main/main_production.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for bootstrapping the production version of the application. It sets up the initial state and configuration for the app, ensuring it runs in the production environment.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The entry point of the application. It calls the `bootstrap` function to initialize the app and render the `AppView`.

files.name: lib/main/main_development.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for bootstrapping the development version of the Flutter application. It sets up the application's entry point and configures the application flavor to be 'development'.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main entry point of the application that initializes the development build of the app.

files.name: lib/models/enums/flavor.dart
files.description: This file defines an enum called `Flavor` with two values: `production` and `development`. It represents the different flavors or environments that the application can run in.

files.name: lib/services/analytic_service.dart
files.description: The AnalyticService class is a wrapper for analytics functionality in the application. It encapsulates the implementation of analytics tracking and provides a centralized interface for managing analytics-related operations.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the AnalyticService, preparing it for use.

files.name: lib/observer/screen_observer.dart
files.description: The ScreenObserver class is responsible for tracking the screen views of the application using the AnalyticService. It is a NavigatorObserver that listens for navigation events and logs screen transitions to the analytics service.

methods.name: didPush
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a new route is pushed onto the navigation stack.

methods.name: didReplace
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a route is replaced in the navigation stack.

methods.name: didPop
methods.description: Tracks the screen view when a route is popped from the navigation stack.

methods.name: _trackScreenView
methods.description: Logs the screen view to the AnalyticService based on the current route.

files.name: lib/ui/common/app_colors.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines a set of reusable color constants that represent the primary color palette of the application. These colors are used throughout the UI to ensure a consistent and branded visual experience.

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet_model.dart
files.description: The NoticeSheetModel class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the notice bottom sheet UI component in the application. It provides the core functionality and business logic for displaying and interacting with the notice sheet.

methods.name: showNotice
methods.description: Displays the notice bottom sheet with the specified message.

methods.name: dismissNotice
methods.description: Dismisses the currently displayed notice bottom sheet.

files.name: lib/ui/common/ui_helpers.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a collection of common UI helper functions and constants that are used throughout the Flutter application's user interface. It serves as a centralized location for managing and accessing various UI-related utilities, ensuring consistency and reusability across the codebase.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class UIHelpers {
  + const horizontalSpaceTiny: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceSmall: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceMedium: Widget
  + const horizontalSpaceLarge: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceTiny: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceSmall: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceMedium: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceLarge: Widget
  + const verticalSpaceMassive: Widget
  + const spacedDivider: Widget
  + verticalSpace(height: double): Widget
  + screenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + screenHeight(context: BuildContext): double
  + screenHeightFraction(context: BuildContext, dividedBy: int, offsetBy: double, max: double): double
  + screenWidthFraction(context: BuildContext, dividedBy: int, offsetBy: double, max: double): double
  + halfScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + thirdScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + quarterScreenWidth(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveSmallFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveMediumFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveLargeFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveExtraLargeFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveMassiveFontSize(context: BuildContext): double
  + getResponsiveFontSize(context: BuildContext, fontSize: double, max: double): double
}
@enduml

methods.name: horizontalSpaceTiny
methods.description: A constant Widget that provides a tiny horizontal space.

methods.name: verticalSpace
methods.description: A function that creates a Widget with a specified vertical space.

methods.name: screenWidth
methods.description: A function that returns the width of the screen.

methods.name: getResponsiveFontSize
methods.description: A function that calculates a responsive font size based on the screen width.

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet.dart
files.description: The NoticeSheet class is responsible for displaying a bottom sheet with a notice or alert message to the user. It is part of the UI layer of the application and is used to present important information or updates to the user in a modal dialog.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: Builds the UI of the NoticeSheet, which includes the title, description, and any other relevant content.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of the NoticeSheetModel, which is used to manage the state and logic of the NoticeSheet.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/info_alert/info_alert_dialog_model.dart
files.description: This Dart file contains the `InfoAlertDialogModel` class, which is responsible for managing the state and behavior of an information alert dialog in a Flutter application.

methods.name: InfoAlertDialogModel
methods.description: The constructor for the `InfoAlertDialogModel` class.

files.name: lib/ui/views/app/app_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The AppViewModel class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the main application view in a Flutter application. It serves as the ViewModel component in the Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) architecture, which separates the presentation logic from the business logic.

files.name: lib/ui/views/home/home_view.dart
files.description: The `HomeView` class is responsible for rendering the main UI of the application's home screen. It provides a simple interface for displaying a counter value and allowing the user to interact with the screen by incrementing the counter, showing a dialog, or displaying a bottom sheet.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: Builds the UI of the home screen, including the counter display, increment button, dialog button, and bottom sheet button.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of the `HomeViewModel` to be used by the `HomeView`.

files.name: lib/ui/views/home/home_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The HomeViewModel class is responsible for managing the state and behavior of the home screen in the application. It provides the core functionality for handling the counter value and displaying it, as well as providing methods to show a custom dialog and a bottom sheet.

methods.name: counterLabel
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the current counter value.

methods.name: incrementCounter
methods.description: Increments the counter value and rebuilds the UI.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.description: Displays a custom dialog with a title and description.

methods.name: showBottomSheet
methods.description: Displays a custom bottom sheet with a title and description.

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_view.dart
files.description: The `StartupView` class in this file is responsible for the initial startup screen of the application. It is the main entry point for the user when they launch the app, displaying the app's logo and a loading indicator while the app's startup logic is being executed.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: Builds the UI for the startup screen, displaying the app's logo and a loading indicator.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of the `StartupViewModel` to be used by the `StartupView`.

methods.name: onViewModelReady
methods.description: Called when the `StartupViewModel` is ready, triggering the execution of the app's startup logic.

files.name: lib/ui/views/startup/startup_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The StartupViewModel class is responsible for handling the initial startup logic of the application. It is responsible for delaying the application launch by a few seconds and then navigating to the home view, which is the main entry point of the application.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: This method is responsible for the core startup logic of the application. It delays the application launch by 3 seconds and then navigates to the home view using the NavigationService.

files.name: lib/config/production/firebase_options_production.dart
files.description: This file defines the Firebase configuration options for the production environment of the application. It is responsible for providing the necessary Firebase-related settings and credentials to integrate the application with the Firebase services in the production environment.

files.name: lib/utils/const/const.dart
files.description: This file contains a set of constant values and data structures that are used throughout the application. It serves as a centralized repository for global configuration and settings, providing a consistent and easily accessible way to manage application-wide constants.

files.name: lib/utils/contact/contact_util.dart
files.description: The `ContactUtil` class provides utility functions for launching WhatsApp and email communication from a Flutter application. It handles the platform-specific logic to open the appropriate communication channels for the user's device.

methods.name: launchWhatsApp
methods.description: Launches the WhatsApp application or the WhatsApp web interface with a pre-filled message and recipient phone number.

methods.name: launchEmail
methods.description: Launches the default email application with the specified email address.

files.name: lib/utils/date/date_util.dart
files.description: The `DateUtil` class provides a set of utility functions for handling date and time data in the application, particularly when interacting with Firestore.

methods.name: fromJson
methods.description: Extracts a `DateTime` object from a dynamic input value, which can be a `Timestamp` from Firestore, a `String` representation of a date and time, or a `DateTime` object directly.

files.name: lib/utils/exceptions/api_exception.dart
files.description: This file defines a custom exception class `APIException` that is used to handle and propagate exceptions that occur during API service interactions. It provides a standardized way to handle and communicate errors that arise in the application's API layer.

methods.name: APIException
methods.description: Constructor for the `APIException` class. Allows for the creation of a new `APIException` instance with an optional error message.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Overrides the default `toString()` method to provide a string representation of the `APIException` instance, including the runtime type and the error message.

files.name: lib/utils/extensions/color_extension.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a custom extension on the Flutter `Color` class, adding utility methods for converting hexadecimal color strings to `Color` objects and integer values. This extension simplifies the process of working with color-related functionality in the application, improving developer productivity and maintainability.

methods.name: fromHex
methods.description: Converts a hexadecimal color string (e.g., '#FF0000' for red) to a `Color` object.

methods.name: intFromHex
methods.description: Converts a hexadecimal color string (e.g., '#FF0000' for red) to an integer value representing the color.

files.name: lib/utils/flavors/flavors.dart
files.description: This file defines a singleton class 'Flavors' that is responsible for managing the current application flavor, which is typically used to differentiate between development, staging, and production environments. The main purpose of this class is to provide a centralized way to access and check the current application flavor, enabling the application to behave differently based on the specific environment it is running in.

methods.name: Flavors
methods.description: Private constructor for the Flavors class, ensuring a singleton instance.

methods.name: Flavors.factory
methods.description: Factory constructor for the Flavors class, returning the singleton instance.

methods.name: isDev
methods.description: Getter that returns true if the current application flavor is Flavor.development.

methods.name: isProd
methods.description: Getter that returns true if the current application flavor is Flavor.production.

files.name: lib/utils/json/json_util.dart
files.description: The JsonUtil class is responsible for providing utility functions to handle JSON data in the application. It solves the problem of safely and consistently parsing and formatting JSON data, which is a common task in modern web and mobile applications.

methods.name: formatMap
methods.description: Converts a Map<dynamic, dynamic> to a Map<String, dynamic> by removing any null keys.

methods.name: fromJsonOrNull
methods.description: Safely converts a dynamic JSON value to an instance of type T, or returns null if the input is invalid.

methods.name: formatListMap
methods.description: Converts a List<dynamic> of JSON objects to a List<T> by applying the given fromJson function to each object.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/info_alert/info_alert_dialog.dart
files.description: This file defines an InfoAlertDialog class, which is responsible for displaying an informative alert dialog with a title, description, and a confirmation button. The primary purpose of this class is to provide a reusable and customizable way to present important information to the user within the application.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: The main build method that constructs the UI for the InfoAlertDialog. It takes the DialogRequest, DialogResponse completer, and the view model as input and returns the final widget.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: A method that creates and returns an instance of the InfoAlertDialogModel, which is used to manage the state and logic of the dialog.

files.name: lib/config/development/firebase_options_development.dart
files.description: This Dart file is responsible for providing the configuration options for the Firebase service in the development environment of the application. It defines the necessary credentials and settings to initialize and interact with the Firebase platform during the development phase.

files.name: lib/app/app.locator.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up and managing the service locator in a Flutter application built using the Stacked architecture pattern. The service locator is a crucial component that allows different parts of the application to access and interact with various services and dependencies, promoting a modular and decoupled design.

methods.name: setupLocator
methods.description: This method is responsible for registering the necessary services and dependencies with the service locator. It allows the application to access and use these services throughout the codebase.

files.name: lib/l10n/l10n.dart
files.description: Centralized localization and internationalization (i18n) configuration export file that provides standardized access to app localization resources and supported language configurations

methods.name: exportLocalizations
methods.description: Exports core localization components for unified language support across the application

files.name: lib/app/app.dialogs.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up and managing the dialog system used throughout the application. It defines the available dialog types, registers the custom dialog builders, and provides a centralized way to interact with the dialog service.

methods.name: setupDialogUi
methods.description: Configures the dialog service by registering the custom dialog builders for each dialog type.

files.name: lib/ui/views/app/app_view.dart
files.description: The `AppView` class is the main entry point for the Flutter application. It is responsible for setting up the overall application structure, including the navigation, localization, and event handling. This class serves as the foundation for the entire application, providing the core functionality and user experience.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the main application widget tree, including the MaterialApp, navigation, localization, and event handling.

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant main
participant AppView
participant StartupView
participant StartupViewModel
participant HomeView
participant HomeViewModel

User -> main: Launch app
main -> AppView: Create and run
AppView -> StartupView: Initialize
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Run startup logic
StartupViewModel -> HomeView: Navigate on completion
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Initialize
User -> HomeView: Interact
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Handle user actions
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI
HomeViewModel -> DialogService: Show dialog
HomeViewModel -> BottomSheetService: Show bottom sheet
@enduml
state_management_flow: The application uses the Stacked architecture for state management. Each view has a corresponding ViewModel that handles the business logic and state for that view. The ViewModels are responsible for updating the UI, interacting with services (e.g., DialogService, BottomSheetService), and managing the application's overall state. The app.locator.dart file sets up the necessary dependency injections, allowing the ViewModels to access the required services.
navigation_flow: The application's navigation is managed using the Stacked Router, defined in app.router.dart. The main entry point is the AppView, which initializes the Stacked architecture and displays the StartupView. After the startup logic is completed, the StartupViewModel navigates to the HomeView. The HomeView allows the user to interact with the application, triggering updates to the HomeViewModel, which in turn updates the UI and can show dialogs or bottom sheets as needed.
